intro: Aphyllon parishii, commonly known as the narrow-leaved aphyllon, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its small, narrow leaves and clusters of white or pale pink flowers. It typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in heathlands and open forests. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and vulnerable species.
